text: [Music]
hello i am
a cloud support engineer here at the aws
office bangalore india
today i will show you how to start
publishing messages to aws iot core from
my device
and confirm whether everything is set up
properly let's get started
after logging into the aws management
console navigate to the iot core console
first let's create a policy for our
certificates
select the secure tab on the left
navigation bar and then select
policies here you can view the available
policies
created for the aws iit core choose
create policy
give the policy a name such as admin set
action as iot star resources as star
and select effect as allow
choose create to save the policy now
proceed to create a thing navigate to
the manage tab
and select things here you can view the
available things
for this region choose create to create
a new thing
select create a single thing and then
give it a name
such as test thing other values such as
thing type
group and attributes are optional and
you can choose to add or skip them
we'll skip them and choose next to
proceed
after that choose create certificates to
generate certificate
public key and private certificates that
are automatically attached to this thing
download all three certificates by
choosing download
which appears next to each of them we'll
download the files
into this certificates folder
we'll also need a fourth certificate
called a root ca certificate
we can get this by navigating to this
link and then choosing amazon root ca
one
copy this certificate into a text editor
and save it as root.pem
in the certificates folder now back in
the console
choose activate to activate the
certificates and then choose attach
policy to proceed
here we'll select the policy we
previously created and then choose
register thing
to complete our registration the
endpoint url
of the aws iot core for this region can
be found by navigating to the settings
tab
let's test our setup using the aws iot
device sdk for python
i have already written a code that
establishes a connection with aws iit
core
and then publishes a few messages to the
topic test
slash testing we'll save the python code
outside of the folder where we
downloaded our certificates
navigate to the iot code console and
choose test
set subscription topic as test slash
testing
now run python3 publish dot py from the
command line
to run this code a few messages were
published to awserity core and as we can
see in the console
those messages have arrived in this
final section of the video
i'll show you how to enable logging for
aws iot core
to do that simply navigate to the im
console
and select roles on the left navigation
bar
here choose create a role choose iot
and again iot choose next to proceed
give this role a name for example iot
logging role
as we can see all the necessary policies
required for logging are already
provided by default
choose create role to save these
settings and then copy the role arn
now open the terminal with aws cli
configured and enter the following
set v2 logging options command to enable
v2 logging
you can view the logs in the amazon
cloudwatch console
in the log group aws iot logs v2 after
successfully publishing a few messages
thank you for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
